author: ajsutton
content:
<@!498009160982724610> Confirmed that the second bootnode is online but the ENR in that repo had the wrong node ID.  https://github.com/eth2-clients/eth2-mainnet/pull/5 updates it to the correct one which I'm getting responses from.

And I can confirm I'm getting far fewer responses from our bootnode than I would have expected or that we get from other nodes.  Something is definitely not right.  I have some wild theories but will need a bit more time to dig into it (I got bogged down a bit today with other stuff unfortunately).

Let me know if this is causing you particular issues and needs to be handled urgently.

author: agemanning
content: Nah not urgent. Just pointing out strange behaviour which may effect tekus discovery.

author: deme1744
content: <@!498009160982724610> The LH bootnodes at https://github.com/eth2-clients/eth2-mainnet/blob/master/bootnodes.txt also didn't get updated (when I compare them with the ones on https://github.com/eth2-clients/eth2-testnets/tree/master/shared/mainnet). There are two PRs lingering now in that repo for bootnode updates :). Is any client actually using that repository?

author: arnetheduck
content: we could simply migrate the testnet repo to `eth2-networks` and get rid of the other one - github rename puts http forwards in place
